Name: Maoz
Review Text: Nice falafel and concept where you fill in what you want. Chips are good too. Probably would say why would you charge for sauce I think that is a show stopper for some. Otherwise everything else is good. Fresh vegetables. I would recommend.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Early nineties there was Falafel Dan which was my favourite because of the fresh lychee juice. Then there was Sonny's Falafel with tables outside across the street from Katsu but unfortunately he decided to wait out the pandemic with his …

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Hands down best falafel in town! super delicious salad bar,  and all VEGAN!

Name: Maoz
Review Text: The staff is very friendly, and the falafel is really good. One of the best things about this place is that you can continue adding toppings while you eat as you deem necessary. Vegans do not have to miss out on fast food!

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Perfect falafels that are crunchy on the outside, soft and most importantly not dry on the inside. Freshly made, incredibly delicious, and unbelievably varied salads sauces and toppings. This is the best falafel in Amsterdam.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: I just love the concept of this place. Get a falafel and load it up with as many toppings as you can eat. This is a must when in Amsterdam for vegans and non-vegans alike. Lower-cost than most other places to eat and the quality is really good for what you're paying.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: This is some of the best falafel I've ever had. And everything is 100% vegan! You can refill your pita as much as you want which makes it an all you can eat buffet for a reasonable price. The pickled eggplant is must!

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Very clean and cozy. Have been here twice already and always leave stuffed, satisfied, and happy. Love that it’s an all you can eat salad bar. I probably go back and re-stuff my falafel 5-10 times during my meal. So so delicious and only 5.50 euros for a falafel with unlimited toppings.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Very tasty falafel! Option for wholemeal pita to make it more healthy. And unlimited toppings from the salad bar (or a decent size box if you ask for takeaway). Very good value for money (€5.50 for a proper meal). Service is also very welcoming and friendly.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: This was the first falafel I ever tried, and some 20 years later it's still as good as I remember, if not better. The generous and indulgent range of toppings makes the price well worth it.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: I visited Maoz in order to relive my days in Berkeley when we had our own Maoz. This location was pretty quiet and just a block or so away from the market, so it was easy to stop in for lunch. I was impressed by the falafel- it was …

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Mushroom shawarma portion has become too little. I've always tried to eat at Maoz in Amsterdam but my recent attempt has turned to negative experience by the minimum stock of the mushroom. When I finally got the chance, the mushroom that …

Name: Maoz
Review Text:
The falafel is tasty as are the salads
But beware of the short gruff man behind the counter who watches if you spill anything and does a cleanup 3very 30 seconds practically...glaring all the while. …

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Simply one of the best falafels out there. Love the fact that you can refill the salad and sauce. Makes every bite different and as good!

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Really small portions.  Price is cheap, but the portions don’t really make sense to me.  3 falafels and all the salad you can cram into a small container.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Incredible. Food was fantastic, service was brilliant. Can go up as many times as you want to the salad bar to keep topping up.  All for €6.  Very friendly staff

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Very rude person behind the counter. Instead of asking us for the order, he was shouting at us and called us "arrogant" when we asked him to lower down his voice. We had already paid but seeing how rude the person behind the counter was, we …

Name: Maoz
Review Text:
Delicious and very filling!
The falafels are very meaty and full of flavour and the unlimited salad refills are great

Name: Maoz
Review Text: I used to.go here when they had one in Soho in London. That one closed a few years ago. The food here was as good as I remember. Quieter than some of the other branches in Amsterdam, so you should get a seat here.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Always happy with the food at Moaz, but I'm writing this review to compliment the extremely friendly staff who work in the De Pijp branch who are always so polite and helpful. Give them all payrises or at least a bonus! ;-)

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Great Falafel with a big choice of toppings with endless refill. Friendly staff and clean but small restaurant

Name: Maoz
Review Text: This location has room to sit and tables, so that is a big plus. Excellent quick falafel and frites.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Fell in love with this place. The best falafal I have ever had in my life. Close your eyes and eat anything at this place

Name: Maoz
Review Text:
Good falafel at a central location.
It's nice to be able to pick exactly what you want as your toppings.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Absolutely love this place! The falafal, the sauces, the add-ons, the Belgian fries all amazing! Hats off!

Name: Maoz
Review Text: The best falafel I had outside the middle east. The sides were good and the service was friendly.

Name: Maoz
Review Text:
Good, but not so many options
Not so cheap, but the falafel was good 🥙

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Very good falafel sandwich. Add the hot green sauce if you want it spicy!

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Great spot for a yummy cheap falafel! €5.50 with unlimited toppings.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Nice fallafel place. Friendly staff. Topping was plentyfull and seems to be as fresh as can be.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: The food is very good but the portions are TINY and the food is expensive. The man behind the till behaved very stressed towards us despite us being the only customers.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Food is good and healthy but it's usually crowded here so expect some quick replies from the workers.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Great tasty falafel and very friendly staff (seemed to be the owner)

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Food is tasty and quality good but I don’t like that everyone can touch everything and it could be cleaner...

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Very impolite staff, started yelling cause i refilled my pita bread with basic salad. The concept was salad refill.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Fantastic falafel with spicy sauce and all vegetarian options.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Superb falafel. Amazing chain in good location . Always good quality.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: the best Falafel ever......sure you will need to try that if you like Falafel....

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Best falafel in Amsterdam. Always fresh and warm.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Limited options but they are alright and cheap. Good spot if you like falafel.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: The food is nice, but it you can go to a different location this one is not friendly at all.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: I don't know why this is so highly rated but I did not enjoy the pita at all!. Will not be going back.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Great food,  best falafel I've ever eaten

Name: Maoz
Review Text:

Review Text: Clean and  cozy restaurant close to the Albert Cyup market. Usually not crowded.

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Tasty falafels especially for vegan

Name: Maoz
Review Text: Amazing, the staff are very nice, food is delicious

Name: Maoz

Review Text: When you crave for vegan and tasty food go maoz.  I love it.
